newsitem.title: USA: US CFTC says copper market probe continues.
newsitem.headline: US CFTC says copper market probe continues.

text.p: U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission declined to comment on the arrest of Sumitomo Corp's former top copper trader Yasuo Hamanaka, but said its investigation of world copper markets continues.

"We're still cooperating with Japanese authorities and the (Securities and Investments Board)," commission spokesman John Phillips said Tuesday. "We are communicating and working together. The investigation is ongoing."
Earlier Tuesday, Tokyo prosecutors arrested Hamanaka, alleged to have run up $2.6 billion in losses at Sumitomo.
Prosecutors charged that Hamanaka forged two documents authorizing transactions with units of Merrill Lynch & Co . Merrill said it conducted all business with Sumitomo properly and "in good faith."
At a news conference in Tokyo, Sumitomo officials said they would also file a complaint against Hamanaka for breach of trust.
CFTC has been actively investigating the copper market since last year, prompted by unusual market conditions that may have been caused by Hamanaka's activities.
